events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their vehicle and another car at a busy intersection during rush hour.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to the description referencing a car collision.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to handle the investigation and further communications with the claimant.
The claimant received official acknowledgment of their reported vehicle accident claim and the next steps were outlined.
The claims department requested additional documents including photos of the damaged vehicle and a police report.
The claimant submitted all requested documents, including photographs and the official police incident report.
Investigation into the vehicle accident was initiated to confirm liability and extent of damages.
The investigation confirmed that the claimant was not at fault and estimated damages to the insured vehicle.
A settlement offer was prepared and sent to the claimant outlining coverage for vehicle repairs and rental reimbursement.
The claimant responded positively to the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the quick resolution process.
The claim was officially approved following agreement on the settlement amount and terms.
Payment was issued to the claimant for vehicle repair costs and rental coverage as per the approved settlement.
The claim was closed after confirmation that repairs were completed and the claimant was satisfied with the outcome.
The entire claim file was archived for record keeping and potential future reference.
